findings.title: Break-glass accounts with password never expires
findings.description: Break-glass accounts should have regular password rotation. Password never expires increases compromise risk.
findings.recommendation: Implement 90-day password rotation for break-glass accounts. Consider using PIM for just-in-time access instead.

findings.title: Break-glass accounts without MFA
findings.description: Break-glass accounts should have MFA enabled. MFA provides critical protection for emergency access accounts.
findings.recommendation: Enable MFA on all break-glass accounts. Consider using Microsoft Entra ID Privileged Identity Management for conditional MFA requirements.

notes: This check identifies accounts with 'break', 'glass', 'emergency', or 'incident' in the name.
This script shows break-glass accounts exist. It cannot answer: Who approved them? When tested? What controls exist?
